selection1_name:
Ann WelshJan 6, 2019, 4:46 PM
I have a Linksys E1200 and I am having to do a cold boot (unplug it and replug it in the reset button does not work) to it about every week. I will have internet(wireless) on my device and then one of them will claim that it is not getting signal (connecting, saved, secerd over and over again) I will have signal on the other device (never the same device each time). I cannot look at the settings for the router even when though I still have internet when connected though I can still search the web. I have already updated the firmware. I was wondering what I could do to fix this issue.

I have a Linksys E1200 and I am having to do a cold boot (unplug it and replug it in the reset button does not work) to it about every week. I will have internet(wireless) on my device and then one of them will claim that it is not getting signal (connecting, saved, secerd over and over again) I will have signal on the other device (never the same device each time). I cannot look at the settings for the router even when though I still have internet when connected though I can still search the web. I have already updated the firmware. I was wondering what I could do to fix this issue.

Rogue LeaderJan 8, 2019, 8:29 PM
As suggested to you in discord:
1. Reset all settings back to stock, follow the basic setup procedures, do not limit your IP addresses or anything else, let the router's DHCP do the work
2. Ensure the Router's IP address is not within your DHCP range
3. If its still doing this, check the router's settings to ensure the router is releasing assigned IP addresses.
4. You may not get an answer from someone who has used this router here before, it is worth contacting Linksys tech support. There is a possibility that the router has an unfixable issue, and will need to be warrantied or replaced.
Ann WelshJan 8, 2019, 8:52 PM
Rogue Leader said:
As suggested to you in discord:
1. Reset all settings back to stock, follow the basic setup procedures, do not limit your IP addresses or anything else, let the router's DHCP do the work Done that and a week later did the same effing thing
2. Ensure the Router's IP address is not within your DHCP range not within range
3. If its still doing this, check the router's settings to ensure the router is releasing assigned IP addresses. It is as the device reconnect to the address they have had before
4. You may not get an answer from someone who has used this router here before, it is worth contacting Linksys tech support. There is a possibility that the router has an unfixable issue, and will need to be warrantied or replaced.
Had it too long for them to help
